question: Why was there great rejoicing in the city and throughout the country?
answer1: The people wished their king all that was good.
answer2: God gave them a little daughter.

question: What type of ruler was the king?
answer1: kind and just

question: Who entered the room while the child lay in its cradle?
answer1: a strange-looking old woman

question: What did the old woman say the child must not be allowed the do?
answer1: be allowed out under the open sky until she were full fifteen years of age

question: What would happen if the child went under the open sky before she was full fifteen years of age?
answer1: The mountain troll would fetch her.

question: What did the king do because of the old woman's words?
answer1: posted guards to watch over the little princess so that she would not get out under the open sky

question: Why did the king grieve?
answer1: He loved his children above everything else in the world.
answer2: The princess must not be allowed out under the open sky.

question: How many princesses did the king and queen have?
answer1: three times

question: Where were the princesses to be kept?
answer1: beneath the roof of the castle

question: What did the three princesses do while sitting in the window?
answer1: looked out and watched the sun shine on the little flowers in the garden
answer2: feel a great desire to play with the lovely flowers

question: Why did the guards not allow the princesses to go outside?
answer1: They feared the king's anger.

question: Why could the guards not deny the king's daughters pleas?
answer1: The king's daughters pleaded so very sweetly.

question: What happened because the three daughters went outside?
answer1: A cloud came suddenly down, and bore them off, and all attempts to regain possession of them were fruitless.

question: What did the guards do when the princesses disappeared?
answer1: search was made in every direction

question: How will the king feel when he learns what happened?
answer1: angry
answer2: upset

question: How did the king plan to get his daughters back?
answer1: Whoever would deliver his three daughters out of the power of the mountain troll should have one of them for his bride, and with her half of the kingdom.

question: Where did a poor widow live?
answer1: far, far out in the wild wood

question: What did the boy do while he crossed the fields?
answer1: whittled himself a flute, and amused himself playing it

question: Who came along while the young-swine herd sat in the woof?
answer1: an old, old man

question: How did the boy feel about the great dog?
answer1: happy
answer2: excited

question: Why was the dog not like other dogs?
answer1: Whatever you told him to take hold of he would seize, even though it were the grimmest of trolls.

question: What did the youth give up in exchange for the dog?
answer1: the gray pig

question: How did the youth's old mother feel about the exchange?
answer1: angry beyond measure

question: Why did the youth command the dog to take hold?
answer1: He did not know what else to do.

question: What happened because the woman had to promise her to make the best of the matter?
answer1: They were friends once more.

question: How will the youth's mother feel when she sees he has exchanged a pig for another dog?
answer1: angry

question: Why did the mother not venture to beat her son?
answer1: She was afraid of the great dog.

question: How many times did the boy make an exchange with the old gray-beard?
answer1: three times

question: Why was the youth happy?
answer1: He thought that now he need fear nothing in the world.

question: How did the dogs help the boy and his mother not suffer want?
answer1: The dogs were good hunters.
answer2: They got lots of meat and all sorts of good things.

question: Where did the old man say the youth's fortune will turn?
answer1: the royal castle

question: What will the youth do at the king's castle?
answer1: request to search for his daughters
answer2: entertain the king

question: How did the king feel when he heard the youth's playing and saw the skillful dancing of his dogs?
answer1: merry
answer2: cheerful

question: Why did the king's thoughts once more grow gloomy?
answer1: The youth had asked about the king's three daughters.
answer2: He was reminded of his daughters.

question: Who will help the youth rescue the princesses?
answer1: his dogs

question: What did "Hark!" tell that master he had heard at a high mountain?
answer1: the king's daughter

question: Why did the dogs break down the door into the mountain?
answer1: The youth ordered his dogs.

question: Who did the youth see when he stepped into the mountain?
answer1: a lovely maiden
answer2: the king's daughter

question: Why did the youth want to wait for the giant's return?
answer1: He wanted to fight the giant.
answer2: He was unafraid of the giant.

question: How will the giant feel when he sees that youth has broken in?
answer1: angry
answer2: furious

question: What did the  youth do after he slayed the giant?
answer1: saddled the giant's colt, loaded it with all the gold and gear he found in the mountain, and hastily went away with the king's beautiful daughter

question: What did the youth do when "Hark!" told him of the second daughter?
answer1: hurried toward the mountain with his faithful dogs

question: How did the two princesses feel when they were reunited?
answer1: glad
answer2: happy

question: Who found all three princesses?
answer1: "Hark!"

question: How did "Hark!" know where the three princesses were located?
answer1: He heard them.
answer2: He has good hearing.
answer3: He went to the high mountain.

question: Why was the giant frightened?
answer1: He knew of the fate that had befallen his brothers.

question: Why did the giant make many fine speeches and was very friendly and smooth with the youth?
answer1: He thought it advisable to fall back upon cunning and treachery, for he had not dared to venture on open battle.

question: Why did the youth forget to be on his guard?
answer1: The troll knew so well how to talk.
answer2: The youth allowed himself to be beguiled by his smooth words.

question: What will happen because the youth sent his dogs away?
answer1: The troll will attack him.
answer2: The dogs will be in danger.

question: What happened when the dogs reached the top of the mountain?
answer1: A high wall rose around them, and they were made a prisoner by the giant's magic power.

question: How did the youth feel when all three dogs were gone, and the giant rose?
answer1: frightened
answer2: regret

question: What did the youth ask to do?
answer1: play a psalm on his flute
answer2: repeat the Lord's prayer

question: Who did the youth fall deeply in love with?
answer1: the youngest princess

question: Who were the two wanderers?
answer1: two princes

question: Why did the two princes seize the youth by the throat and strangle him?
answer1: They were jealous of the youth.
answer2: They wanted to win power and glory for themselves.

question: Why was the whole court full of joy and merriment?
answer1: The three princesses had returned.
answer2: It was the oldest princess's wedding day.
